blog.description: Hello there!  The name is Em, aged 28. Teacher during the day, avid fan girl by night. Shows include, Cloak and Dagger, The Punisher, Luke Cage, Stranger Things, Game of Thrones and video games, I live off of that in the spare time that I get. Any prompts can be directed to my inbox and I am always open to talk

summary: So in the wake of trying to ignore GoT. I started a new game in fallout 4 since fallout 76 is crap in my opinion. I did however...
body: So in the wake of trying to ignore GoT. I started a new game in fallout 4 since fallout 76 is crap in my opinion. I did however make Daenerys as my sole survivor. The question is, what faction should she side with? Brotherhood, Minute men, or railroad.

tags: this wasn’t supposed to be such a long answer but ✌🏻🤷🏼‍♀️
summary: Am i the only one who miss the time when jon had a personality and characterization, and wasnt just reacting to thing and saying...
question: Am i the only one who miss the time when jon had a personality and characterization, and wasnt just reacting to thing and saying in loop "i dont want to be king" "you are my queen", like its kinda been a problem since he was resurrected (thing that wasnt even treated as a big of a deal for some reason) and now that he finally discver who he really is after 20+ years who is parents are, its only used to create contrast eith dany, not even a reaction or showing us he and bran discussing the thing
answer:
Everything about this season has been used against Daenerys for the sheer purpose of driving her (and me) insane to be honest. The only point of revealing his true identity was to undermine everything she’d worked and gained in the last 7 years. We didn’t even SEE him really process the fact that his parents loved one another or that they loved him. The only point of Jon this season was to support Daenerys up until the very last second before he kills her. They literally made him an extra in her ‘I’m mad’ show and he’ll be the hero of the story once he murders her.

What really gets me about this whole season… yes Daenerys cares for the throne but book!dany would fucking rejoice in the fact that she is not the last Targaryen. That is a burden that has laid on her shoulders since Rhaego. ‘If Aegon had lived, I might have married him.’ HELLO?? Book!jon wouldn’t give a flying fuck that she’s his aunt. The Starks have married cousin to cousin for centuries and GRRM himself has said that an aunt marrying a nephew is very common in westeros. This ain’t new to this boy.

ALSO another thing; they’ve made Daenerys way more ambitious than she is in the books and way less ambitious than he is in the books. Book!jon used to dream about being Lord of Winterfell and feel guilty about it because hE’s A bAsTaRd blah blah but Jon Snow is super ambitious in the books and they totally took that away from show!jon. Book!dany is still ambitious of course, but her main focus is to help people. Girl literally dreams about running away from the pressures of ruling, being simple common folk, man and wife with Dario with her red door house and lemon tree. I hate that they made her so throne crazy.. and it’s not a bad thing at all, what’s bad is that they’ve vilified her for being ambitious while also making jon a saint for not being ambitious. It’s ridiculous!

They just took ASOIAF and tore it in HALF. Tore it to SHREDS. Game of Thrones s8? I don’t know her!

tags: I've seen this coming for a while now
I don't know about everyone else but I'm super down with this season
summary: So...Dany’s going to try to kill all the people who know the truth, right?  She’s already killed Varys, it looks like she’ll at...
body:
So…Dany’s going to try to kill all the people who know the truth, right?  She’s already killed Varys, it looks like she’ll at least go after Tyrion next, (who knows if she’ll get him or not) and we have reason to believe that Sansa and Jon are on her list too.  It’s not a far stretch to include Arya, Bran and Sam in the list of people she means to kill.  Not after King’s Landing, at least.

The Iron Throne isn’t hers by right anymore, so she’ll just kill all the people who know the truth and lie to the rest.  Now there’s a good ruler for you…

summary: so this i don’t like  people are saying this shot directly parrels one of hitler’s photos (which no, i will not show because i...
caption:
so this

i don’t like 

people are saying this shot directly parrels one of hitler’s photos (which no, i will not show because i don’t want to save or even look at a picture of him)

a big group of poc is being compared to nazis? nazis????? daenerys is being compared to hitler? are you fucking kidding me????

what kind of message does this send

according to leaks here, she makes a speech about how she wants them to continue their work in freeing every slave 

are we really going to make this narrative ‘evil’?

freeing slaves is now evil and she ‘must be stopped because hitler 2.0′ ???? 

the ONLY pocs left are going ‘crazy’ and freeing slaves is being equated to some ‘evil’ act?

are you fucking kidding me

this is the narrative?

they are trying to tell me these people along with dany are the ‘evil ones all along’

the message is shit just like the writers and i’m mad beyond belief

summary: Mad Queen
title: Mad Queen
body:
I don’t know guys like… I get it people are angry. I am disappointed by some aspects of the show myself, but I am not disappointed nor surprised nor angry about the Daenerys Mad Queen twist. I am sad, because I think after all she’s been through, she would deserve better. On the other hand, I have always seen that coming since I have paid attention to those small details, to the foreshadowing… and I actually like the Mad Queen twist, because it is typically Game of Thrones. It is shocking to turn someone you have been rooting for for so long and you love into a villain. That is exactly what Game of Thrones does to people. I wish she didn’t go mad… for all those people’s sake… for her own sake. But I have seen it coming and as a Game of Thrones fan, I even like it actually, even though it is brutal and it left me emotionally numb and heartbroken. 

But here is my point. I do feel like the last season is rushed. I think that what they did in those 5 episodes so far should have much longer approach. I would say… one season for the Night King storyline and other season for the actual King’s Landing storyline… it would save us a lot of disappointment I guess. And maybe if those signs of Dany’s madness were a bit more subtle and not so obvious, it would also make more sense for Tyrion and Jon to follow her even at this point. Since they needed to rush things, they did hurt the show BUT… I kind of hate when people say that it was out of character for Dany to burn those innocent people and that “foreshadowing does not mean a good character development” but lets face it. 

In what case is madness actually in someone’s character? Let’s imagine it. You have just lost half of your army, two of your best friends, your two children, man you considered a friend and advisor tried to betray and murder you. You feel alone and lost and unloved. And then, you see the Red Keep that was built by your ancesters, it is laughing in your face, reminding you of all the misery you had to come through to finally get there and you are starting to realize it was all for nothing. And then suddenly… it is just too much to handle. It is too much to bare, all those horrible things you have been through, all the trauma, all those losses. And you lose it. You lose your mind, because it is just TOO much to handle. Your brain has had enough. Game over. 

It totally makes sense. Because madness does not make sense. It is the opposite of sense. You can be completely normal and the next day… you decide to murder someone. Madness is not something that sends a letter to everyone saying “Hello, I am going to invade someone’s mind so beware!” It is not really someone you can fight, especially not when you are alone or you at least feel like you are alone. Madness is NOT a choice. Any mental illness is not a choice. She did not chose to go mad, she lost her mind as same as her father did. If madness runs in your family, it is even worse. Targaryens were fucking each other for generations, the degeneration is a real problem too, by the way. The fact she never did anything like this before does not have to do anything with it. Going mad is something you cannot really say no to, if it is already invading your mind. This is why the foreshadowing is enough for me. 

I have many issues with this last season… but this particular aspect is not one of them. And I know that a lot of people will not agree with me, but it is how I see it. Probably also because I personally struggle with mental illness and I feel like if you are on edge once, it is really hard not to fall into it or go back. I totally hate that she killed so many people, I am not justifying what she did by this post in any way… This is simply my interpretation and my feelings and things that I believe to be true, so if you feel like you need to tell me I am a total bitch, feel free to do so, but I don’t really care.

On the other hand, I have always seen that coming since I have paid attention to those small details, to the foreshadowing… and I actually like the Mad Queen twist, because it is typically Game of Thrones. It is shocking to turn someone you have been rooting for for so long and you love into a villain. That is exactly what Game of Thrones does to people. I wish she didn’t go mad… for all those people’s sake… for her own sake. But I have seen it coming and as a Game of Thrones fan, I even like it actually, even though it is brutal and it left me emotionally numb and heartbroken. 

But here is my point. I do feel like the last season is rushed. I think that what they did in those 5 episodes so far should have much longer approach. I would say… one season for the Night King storyline and other season for the actual King’s Landing storyline… it would save us a lot of disappointment I guess. And maybe if those signs of Dany’s madness were a bit more subtle and not so obvious, it would also make more sense for Tyrion and Jon to follow her even at this point. Since they needed to rush things, they did hurt the show BUT… I kind of hate when people say that it was out of character for Dany to burn those innocent people and that “foreshadowing does not mean a good character development” but lets face it. 

In what case is madness actually in someone’s character? Let’s imagine it. You have just lost half of your army, two of your best friends, your two children, man you considered a friend and advisor tried to betray and murder you. You feel alone and lost and unloved. And then, you see the Red Keep that was built by your ancesters, it is laughing in your face, reminding you of all the misery you had to come through to finally get there and you are starting to realize it was all for nothing. And then suddenly… it is just too much to handle. It is too much to bare, all those horrible things you have been through, all the trauma, all those losses. And you lose it. You lose your mind, because it is just TOO much to handle. Your brain has had enough. Game over. 

It totally makes sense. Because madness does not make sense. It is the opposite of sense. You can be completely normal and the next day… you decide to murder someone. Madness is not something that sends a letter to everyone saying “Hello, I am going to invade someone’s mind so beware!” It is not really someone you can fight, especially not when you are alone or you at least feel like you are alone. Madness is NOT a choice. Any mental illness is not a choice. She did not chose to go mad, she lost her mind as same as her father did. If madness runs in your family, it is even worse. Targaryens were fucking each other for generations, the degeneration is a real problem too, by the way. The fact she never did anything like this before does not have to do anything with it. Going mad is something you cannot really say no to, if it is already invading your mind. This is why the foreshadowing is enough for me. 

I have many issues with this last season… but this particular aspect is not one of them. And I know that a lot of people will not agree with me, but it is how I see it. Probably also because I personally struggle with mental illness and I feel like if you are on edge once, it is really hard not to fall into it or go back. I totally hate that she killed so many people, I am not justifying what she did by this post in any way… This is simply my interpretation and my feelings and things that I believe to be true, so if you feel like you need to tell me I am a total bitch, feel free to do so, but I don’t really care.
trail.content:
I don’t know guys like… I get it people are angry. I am disappointed by some aspects of the show myself, but I am not disappointed nor surprised nor angry about the Daenerys Mad Queen twist. I am sad, because I think after all she’s been through, she would deserve better. On the other hand, I have always seen that coming since I have paid attention to those small details, to the foreshadowing… and I actually like the Mad Queen twist, because it is typically Game of Thrones. It is shocking to turn someone you have been rooting for for so long and you love into a villain. That is exactly what Game of Thrones does to people. I wish she didn’t go mad… for all those people’s sake… for her own sake. But I have seen it coming and as a Game of Thrones fan, I even like it actually, even though it is brutal and it left me emotionally numb and heartbroken. 

But here is my point. I do feel like the last season is rushed. I think that what they did in those 5 episodes so far should have much longer approach. I would say… one season for the Night King storyline and other season for the actual King’s Landing storyline… it would save us a lot of disappointment I guess. And maybe if those signs of Dany’s madness were a bit more subtle and not so obvious, it would also make more sense for Tyrion and Jon to follow her even at this point. Since they needed to rush things, they did hurt the show BUT… I kind of hate when people say that it was out of character for Dany to burn those innocent people and that “foreshadowing does not mean a good character development” but lets face it. 

In what case is madness actually in someone’s character? Let’s imagine it. You have just lost half of your army, two of your best friends, your two children, man you considered a friend and advisor tried to betray and murder you. You feel alone and lost and unloved. And then, you see the Red Keep that was built by your ancesters, it is laughing in your face, reminding you of all the misery you had to come through to finally get there and you are starting to realize it was all for nothing. And then suddenly… it is just too much to handle. It is too much to bare, all those horrible things you have been through, all the trauma, all those losses. And you lose it. You lose your mind, because it is just TOO much to handle. Your brain has had enough. Game over. 

It totally makes sense. Because madness does not make sense. It is the opposite of sense. You can be completely normal and the next day… you decide to murder someone. Madness is not something that sends a letter to everyone saying “Hello, I am going to invade someone’s mind so beware!” It is not really someone you can fight, especially not when you are alone or you at least feel like you are alone. Madness is NOT a choice. Any mental illness is not a choice. She did not chose to go mad, she lost her mind as same as her father did. If madness runs in your family, it is even worse. Targaryens were fucking each other for generations, the degeneration is a real problem too, by the way. The fact she never did anything like this before does not have to do anything with it. Going mad is something you cannot really say no to, if it is already invading your mind. This is why the foreshadowing is enough for me. 

I have many issues with this last season… but this particular aspect is not one of them. And I know that a lot of people will not agree with me, but it is how I see it. Probably also because I personally struggle with mental illness and I feel like if you are on edge once, it is really hard not to fall into it or go back. I totally hate that she killed so many people, I am not justifying what she did by this post in any way… This is simply my interpretation and my feelings and things that I believe to be true, so if you feel like you need to tell me I am a total bitch, feel free to do so, but I don’t really care.

tags: Emilia better get all the awards...
But aside for that I hope the show gets NONE
summary: I honestly don’t understand how anyone can think this is a satisfactory end to such an iconic character, any character really -...
caption:
I honestly don’t understand how anyone can think this is a satisfactory end to such an iconic character, any character really - even someone like Cersei - who from the inception of the show and books has been somewhat of the MAD QUEEN…

Even if you hate the character of Daenerys Targaryen and always have - this turn,this end is just horrid…

When we first me Daenerys she is a meek,frightened,abused girl- She’s  literally  a pawn - sold for a THRONE - She’s an incredbly vulnerable character…

Through her own will and perseverence she becomes strong and powerful and a force and person to be reckoned with…

That is not saying that she’s perfect or that her character doesn’t have attributes that are less than desirable…

But to  then have this character after all they’ve been through end up in worse postion than that in which they started -

More vulnerable,  more broken,devasted, sad,alone - ,

Literally destoyed there is just something so brutal and ,unsavory in this message..

I can’t really put it into words but it almsot feels sadistic and perverse…

I HATE this end for Daenerys character but at least find solace in the fact that Emilia has stepped up and acted her heart out and shown that like Daenerys her heart was broken as well that such a strong,powerful character was brought down SO LOW…..

Daenerys is the REAL VICTIM here IMO at least… - Also unlike some of GRRM’s faves apparently always a victim….

I’m not going to count all the INNOCENTS she killed because the Daenerys they presented to me for 8 years wouldn’t do that…

summary: The song Dire Wolf by Grateful Dead was on the Game of Thrones playlist D&D made. They said the songs correspond to events and...
body:
The song Dire Wolf by Grateful Dead was on the Game of Thrones playlist D&D made. They said the songs correspond to events and characters in the show. Here are the lyrics:

In the timbers to Fennario

The wolves are runnin’ round
The winter was so hard and cold
Froze ten feet ‘neath the ground

Don’t murder me, I beg of you
Don’t murder me, please, don’t murder me

I sat down to my supper
It was a bottle of red whisky
I said my prayers and went to bed
That’s the last they saw of me

Don’t murder me, I beg of you
Don’t murder me, please, don’t murder me

When I awoke, the dire wolf
Six hundred pounds of sin
Was grinning at my window
All I said was, “Come on in”

Don’t murder me
I beg of you, don’t murder me
Please don’t murder me

The wolf came in, I got my cards
We sat down for a game
I cut my deck to the queen of spades
But the cards were all the same

Don’t murder me
I beg of you, don’t murder me
Please don’t murder me
Don’t murder me

In the backwash of Fennario
The black and bloody mire
The dire wolf collects his due
While the boys sing round the fire

Don’t murder me
I beg of you, don’t murder me
Please don’t murder me

‘Fennario’ is another name by which the Scottish folk song ‘Bonnie Lass O’Fyvie’ is referred. It’s a song about a thwarted romance between a soldier and a girl.

I’m not saying it’s DEFINITELY what it looks like but…I’m intrigued that’s all.

tags: pls look at this without your shipper lenses and see how f*cked up it all is
summary: all criticisms and ships aside... is there ANYONE in this fandom really satisfied with the story that has become part of...
body:
all criticisms and ships aside…
is there ANYONE in this fandom really satisfied with the story that has become part of contemporary pop culture being concluded with a woman being murdered by a man (who she trusted and loved ~ what makes it all worse) in 2019? doesn’t this blatant misogyny bother you at all? even if you hate or are indifferent to daenerys - the character - you must recognize her impact and importance on the plot to the point of respecting her and agreeing that she deserved a better end. jon too.

tags: did you see what the D's said
had all that crap not happened to her
we would have never seen that side of Daenerys Targaryen
it would have only take one of those things
to not happen or happen in a less crappy way
throw her entire life away over her complete heartbreak
one bad string of events and you just lose it
granted I didn't murder millions of people
I threw mexican food all over the floor at a restaurant and yelled
but still it's the same damned principal
I just want this poor girl to have a friend again buuuu
